sections.intro:
Our focus is at the intersection of real world products and cutting edge tech. We apply human craft and analysis, combined with AI tools and software engineering best practise, to achieve the optimum system for your business.

Make tech work for you. We have decades of experience in creating digital systems. With that comes the ability to engineer something that works, efficiently and cost effectively.

Panko is run by humans, for humans…

work.title: Reconnaitre
work.description: Rapid front-end build. Bootstrap 5. Responsive goodness for drone start-up.

work.title: Carlton Natural Blonde
work.description: Retro Galaga. I can remember having a wicked time smashing out the code for this in 6 days. It needed to be embedded into a larger marketing site. I was able to find all the original SFX online. It was not the full game and was not meant to be but it was a lot of fun and I later hosted it separately with it's own scoreboard API.

work.title: Bridge Alert
work.description: Firebase storage, Geofencing, Map based routing, Push notifications. Had a lot of fun prototyping, building and testing this React Native app. Launched in 2017 and gained some popularity around Australia.

work.title: WorkSafe Projects
work.description: Innovation centre was a very educational experience, to go into as a software engineer. Teamed up with service designers and researchers. Interviewed injured workers. Learned the power of the double-diamond, and design workshop synthesis as part of systems thinking. Developed various tools and web apps. This one had a passwordless sign-in, and was piloted by the Victorian government, helping the incapacitated in many ways. Had fun learning Tailwind CSS on this one.

work.title: RevitCourse
work.description: Custom-built multi-location course booking system featuring payment gateway integration and PDF certificate generation. With some customisation of the google map styling.

work.title: SLSA Surf Lifesaving Squad
work.description: Teamed up with this cool Sydney agency, and went to what is arguably the best office in Australia, the HQ of SLSA at Bondi Beach. When I made these games I decided to focus on some more hardcore software engineering principles. So I read a lot about MVC design patterns and that was fully utilised throughout the codebase. I think as the project code scaled it paid dividends even though it felt slower at first.

work.title: Game of life
work.description: Take home coding exercise which I got a bit carried away with.

work.title: FLUX Clothing
work.description: My first e-commerce site - which took paypal and eWay credit card payments. Can remember that hallelujah moment when the gateway was all wired up correctly. Shopify didn't exist when I was doing this. Had some rad fun animating components for the FLUX crew.

work.title: MCG Club Songs
work.description: Started to work more on kiosk and touch screen systems. Was commissioned to add a new club song to this installation at the Australian Sports Museum. Early IOT / Electronic messaging gateway work.

work.title: MCG AFL Scoreboard System
work.description: It's not every day you're hired to build a timed interactive scoring system which generates video signals to show large sports stadium crowds. Huge application.

work.title: Milk Skincare
work.description: For the swimming legend Michael's Milk Skincare start up I was there at the outset, hand-rolled my own e-commerce system made with my Popcorn CMS. Pre-shopify. As my second e-commerce site, it helped to launch this start up. Lessons learned from doing this project are still with me to this day. Test Coverage anyone?
